definition: everyone has their likes and dislikes (idiom)
each/every
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
everyone has their likes and dislikes/there is no accounting for taste/chacun son goût

sentences.english: The English drinks the tea shade to be to each their own, but the general love adds the milk in the tea soup.
sentences.chinese: 英國人飲茶濃淡各有所好，但一般愛在茶湯中加牛奶。

definition: opinions differ (idiom)
The benevolent sees benevolence, the wise sees wisdom./Different views are admissible. (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 zhe3 jian4 ren2 , zhi4 zhe3 jian4 zhi4

definition: it's difficult to please everyone (idiom)
lit. in the eyes of a lover appears 西施[Xi1 shi1] (idiom); fig. beauty is in the eye of the beholder

esthetic conception/esthetic point of view/standard
one man's meat is another man's poison (idiom)

definition: to lump different matters together (idiom)
each takes what he needs (idiom)
Appetite and lust are only natural (Mencius 6A:4)./By nature we desire food and sex.
not all gold is sufficiently red (idiom); no-one is perfect
esthetics/appreciating the arts/taste

complete and beautiful/to be perfect (idiom)
one's passion/one's obsession
an eye for beauty/aesthetic judgment
